author: Paul Dickson
title: The Heartbreaking Pursuit of Baseball’s Holy Grail
text: Baseball exhibits two characteristics largely absent from other sports. One is an absolute obsession with numbers or, as one writer put it: “Baseball is an island of activity amidst a sea of statistics.” Baseball also relishes comparisons and parallels from one era to another, even when they date back more than a hundred years. Both these characteristics are on display in Joe Cox’s “Almost Perfect: The Heartbreaking Pursuit of Pitching’s Holy Grail,” in which the author looks at 16 players who, between 1908 and 2015, almost threw a perfect game—a game in which a pitcher (or combination of pitchers) wins a victory...
